## Useful Info

**Entropy weavers** are potentially devastating humanoid casters, capable of quickly inflicting [corrosion](/Corrosion "Corrosion"), rendering a character extremely weak and vulnerable. They can be found in [the Spider's Nest](/The_Spider%27s_Nest "The Spider's Nest") and rarely in [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), usually accompanied by several [spiders](/List_of_arthropods#Arachnids "List of arthropods").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                    |                                                     |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Entropic Weave](/Entropic_Weave "Entropic Weave") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- The best way to counter Entropic Weave is to fight weavers separately from other monsters. Stairs are your friends here.

  - Keep in mind that spells, wands, and Invocations are unaffected by corrosion. If you get corroded, you can switch to attacks that don't involve your weapons.
  - If weapons are your only way to fight, and you get severely corroded, be prepared to make a hasty retreat. With four relatively powerful attacks, even a lone entropy weaver can quickly shred you - having other enemies around only makes it worse.

- Wearing a [ring of resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") (or any other form of [corrosion resistance](/Corrosion_resistance "Corrosion resistance")) reduces the chance of being corroded by 50%. Since it doesn't provide immunity, you should still try your best to kill them quickly.

- Entropy weavers can rarely spawn in [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair") as part of a [vault](/Vault "Vault"). It can be wise to skip a floor with an early entropy weaver, and come back later.

- Entropy weaver [simulacra](/Simulacra "Simulacra") are deadly, due to their 4 cold-boosted attacks - they can deal up to {52 physical + 84 cold} damage per turn. Like all simulcara, they are frail, so if created use any form of ranged means you can.
  - Simulacra are often created by [pharaoh ants](/Pharaoh_ant "Pharaoh ant"). When the ant dies, it casts [Bind Souls](/Bind_Souls "Bind Souls") - killing the weaver after creates a simulacrum. Killing the weaver before the ant prevents Bind Souls from being cast.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), entropy weavers had 13 [HD](/HD "HD"), but no Fighter flag. This made entropy weaver [simulacra](/Simulacra "Simulacra") significantly more deadly (156 cold damage *plus* the same physical damage).
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), you could find entropy weavers in ant-themed [vaults](/Vault "Vault"). You could find 2 entropy weavers at a time, even in [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), entropy weavers could pick up and use weapons and armour.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), entropy weavers used [Chant Word of Entropy](/Chant_Word_of_Entropy "Chant Word of Entropy") instead of [Entropic Weave](/Entropic_Weave "Entropic Weave"). Chant Word of Entropy required several turns to take effect, but applied 4 stacks of corrosion.
- Entropy weavers were added in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").

Useful Info

Entropy weavers are potentially devastating humanoid casters, capable of quickly inflicting corrosion, rendering a character extremely weak and vulnerable. They can be found in the Spider's Nest and rarely in the Vaults, usually accompanied by several spiders.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Entropic Weave Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • The best way to counter Entropic Weave is to fight weavers separately from other monsters. Stairs are your friends here.
    • Keep in mind that spells, wands, and Invocations are unaffected by corrosion. If you get corroded, you can switch to attacks that don't involve your weapons.
    • If weapons are your only way to fight, and you get severely corroded, be prepared to make a hasty retreat. With four relatively powerful attacks, even a lone entropy weaver can quickly shred you - having other enemies around only makes it worse.
  • Wearing a ring of resist corrosion (or any other form of corrosion resistance) reduces the chance of being corroded by 50%. Since it doesn't provide immunity, you should still try your best to kill them quickly.
  • Entropy weavers can rarely spawn in the Lair as part of a vault. It can be wise to skip a floor with an early entropy weaver, and come back later.
  • Entropy weaver simulacra are deadly, due to their 4 cold-boosted attacks - they can deal up to {52 physical + 84 cold} damage per turn. Like all simulcara, they are frail, so if created use any form of ranged means you can.
    • Simulacra are often created by pharaoh ants. When the ant dies, it casts Bind Souls - killing the weaver after creates a simulacrum. Killing the weaver before the ant prevents Bind Souls from being cast.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, entropy weavers had 13 HD, but no Fighter flag. This made entropy weaver simulacra significantly more deadly (156 cold damage plus the same physical damage).
  • Prior to 0.27, you could find entropy weavers in ant-themed vaults. You could find 2 entropy weavers at a time, even in the Lair.
  • Prior to 0.26, entropy weavers could pick up and use weapons and armour.
  • Prior to 0.18, entropy weavers used Chant Word of Entropy instead of Entropic Weave. Chant Word of Entropy required several turns to take effect, but applied 4 stacks of corrosion.
  • Entropy weavers were added in 0.17.
